abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the SEGBA Power
            Distribution Project for Argentina were as follows: the
            outcome was unsatisfactory, the sustainability was likely,
            the institutional development impact was modest, and the
            Bank and borrower performance were both unsatisfactory. The
            lessons learned indicate that an implementing agency must be
            accountable to some form of governing body and have a clear
            and transparent organizational structure. Local institutions
            need to play major role in the decision-making process and
            in implementing relevant mitigatory measures. Environmental
            management plans, and more importantly resettlement plans,
            need to be considered an investment priority and implemented
            in coordination with the construction phase of the main
            civil works in order to mitigate potential future conflicts.
            The complexity and management commitment required to manage
            Involuntary Resettlement is often underestimated.
            Environmental management and resettlement/rehabilitation
            plans should be immediately updated when unforeseen delays
            and situations arise. Siting of hydroelectric dams is the
            single most important decision shaping environmental and
            social issues. A good communications program is critical.
            Due to a lack of sufficient baseline information, Yacyreta
            Binational Entity (EBY) has repeatedly been unable to
            respond properly to claims as they arise, which has resulted
            in increased social conflicts. Land acquisition and
            resettlement must be linked. Phased resettlement, in
            addition to adding costs, also incurs greater social disruption.
